project_name: Transit Station Site Acquisition - Yonge & Eglinton
issue: Board approval required for $1,850,000 property acquisition to secure transit station site

background.context: The Yonge-Eglinton Crosstown LRT project requires acquisition of 2550 Yonge Street for the new transit station. This is a strategic site at a major transit hub with existing subway and planned LRT connections. Early acquisition is critical to maintain project schedule and avoid cost escalation. The property is currently occupied by a 3-storey mixed-use building with ground floor retail and residential units above.

key_milestones.milestone: Initial site identification and feasibility study

analysis.strategic_rationale: This acquisition is strategically critical for the Yonge-Eglinton transit hub development. The site provides optimal multi-modal connectivity with existing subway Lines 1 and 2, plus the planned Crosstown LRT. Early acquisition prevents holdout risk and cost escalation in a rapidly appreciating market. The location supports Transit-Oriented Development (TOD) with high existing density (350+ people/hectare) and strong pedestrian catchment (45,000+ within 800m walk radius).

cons: 200m further from optimal transit connection point
Poor pedestrian access - requires underground tunnel
Additional construction costs estimated at $800,000 for tunnel

pros: Better TOD potential - larger development site
Potential for lower price if market softens
cons: Increases risk of holdout and expropriation

benefits: Secures optimal site for major transit hub (Lines 1, 2, Crosstown LRT)
Maintains LRT project schedule - avoids cascading delays
Prevents holdout risk and cost escalation in hot market
Supports Transit-Oriented Development (TOD) with high density (350+ people/hectare)
Willing seller at market value - avoids expropriation costs and delays

precedents.similarity: Similar multi-parcel assembly, comparable market conditions
precedents.outcome: Successful negotiated acquisition at $1.2M. Early acquisition saved estimated $400k vs. delayed purchase.

precedents.similarity: Mixed-use building acquisition for station entrance
precedents.outcome: Negotiated settlement at appraised value avoided 14-month expropriation delay and $200k legal costs.

recommendation: Approve acquisition of 2550 Yonge Street at $1,850,000
rationale: Recommended acquisition at $1.85M is 12% above budget but represents best value when considering alternatives. Alternative sites would result in higher all-in costs ($2.2M for Site A with tunnel, $1.6M base for Site B plus 18-month expropriation delay worth $500k+). Deferring acquisition risks market appreciation ($50k-100k/month) and potential holdout. Owner is willing seller at appraised market value - delaying risks losing cooperation and forcing expropriation. Strategic location optimizes transit connectivity and TOD potential.

risks.risk: Budget overrun - acquisition cost 8.8% above approved budget
risks.impact: Requires budget reallocation or supplementary approval
risks.mitigation: Secure contingency approval from Finance Committee. Offset with savings from other line items in Transit Expansion Fund.

risks.risk: Tenant relocation delays - commercial tenant has 6-month lease remainder
risks.impact: Potential 3-6 month delay in taking possession
risks.mitigation: Negotiate early termination with tenant. Offer relocation assistance ($60k disturbance budget). Include vacant possession requirement in purchase agreement.

risks.risk: Environmental contamination - former gas station on adjacent property
risks.mitigation: Phase II Environmental Site Assessment prior to closing. Include environmental indemnity in purchase agreement. Budget contingency for remediation.

risks.risk: Owner withdrawal - seller may entertain competing offers during approval process
risks.impact: Loss of site, forced to pursue alternatives or expropriation (18+ month delay, $500k+ additional costs)
risks.mitigation: Execute binding Agreement of Purchase and Sale with deposit upon Board approval. Expedite approval process (target 30 days). Maintain strong relationship with seller.

risks.risk: Title defects - potential unregistered easements or encroachments
risks.impact: Minor title clearing costs $10k-25k, potential 2-4 week delay
risks.mitigation: Complete title search and survey prior to closing. Include title insurance requirement. Budget for minor title clearing.
